ovdesc.p: Defines the participants of the bundle and indicates the mandatory and optional participants. At the designer level, only defines the 'blueprint' of the composition of this bundle. The actual arrangement references would be allowed only at the arrangement level.The condition also links the participants with the INTEREST.COMPENSATION property condition.

Indicates whether the product is mandatory for the bundle to operate. If the product is marked mandatory, the customer who opts for this bundle SHOULD have atleast one arrangement belonging to this product. Otherwise, the customer is considered to be 'ineligible' for this bundle product. As many mandatory products can be stated as part of the definition. For example, the definition could insist on 'atleast' 2 savings accounts product for the bundle in which case, there would be 2 multi-values where this would be flagged as YES for the same product group.
Validation Rules:
1. YES - indicates whether arrangement of this group should exist for this customer for the user to become eligible to take this bundle
2. No - indicates it is not mandatory to state an arrangement for this product. But, may be stated if the customer has one.

Indicates the INTEREST.COMPENSATION property which is linked to this bundle. Only one master could be defined(if more than one Arrangement exists) and the arrangement against which the master is stated is assumed to be the Recipient or beneficiary arrangement in this bundle setup. All other participants are assumed to be donors.
Validation Rules:
1. Should be a valid property of INTEREST.COMPENSATION class
2. Property should belong to the current bundle product
3. Only one master type definition allowed
4. One master definition should exist in this condition

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.

Bundle Definition is enhanced to allow specification of participating arrangements at their Product level.

Ex, if a Notional Pooling allows only a certain type of “Checking Account” to be participants, then an existing Normal Current Account might need to be changed to “Checking Account” product before it can be added to a Bundle
In the example above, both “Checking Account” and “Normal Current Account” will be part of the ‘Current Accounts’ Product Group.
However, in the Bundle condition, instead of specifying this product group, we would instead, specify ‘Checking Account’ in a new field that can accept a valid AA Product.
This new field will be mutually exlcusive to the existing Product Group field. Either the Product Group or a Product should be required

2. Should be a valid entry in AA.PRODUCT.GROUP

Relevant only at the ""Arrangement"" level and cannot be defined during the 'designer' stage. When a bundle arrangement is drawn for a customer, this field would indicate the related arrangement references for the product group mentioned above. System would not allow a duplicate on this field. The field would link the various arrangement references and form a bundle under this arrangement. System would automatically update the AA.ARRANGEMENT record of stated arrangements with bundle references. The field arrangement which has the MASTER.TYPE defined against it is considered as the ""Recipient"" and all other arrangements are considered to be ""Donors"". The property to pool the balances to are defined in the INTEREST.COMPENSATION property defined as part of MASTER.TYPE field.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory input when the associated field is flagged as MANDATORY
Duplicates not allowed
Arrangement should belong to the group defined in the associated set
Input allowed only at the Arrangement level.

No input and multi value field - lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. This is system maintained and is crucial for Reverse and Replay functionality. This field indicates which attributes have undergone a change in this instance. The difference between this field in NEGOTIATED.FLDS is that the latter would hold ALL the negotiations that have happened till this moment and CHANGED.FIELDS would only hold the negotiated fields for that activity.
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for ex : CHANGE.PRODUCT) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
The overall definition may be stated as RESETTING and certain individual attributes may be set to NON-RESETTING as well. This could be done using the NR.ATTRIBUTE fields.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
Not used in Arrangement/Sim level.
